source_note: State baseline derived from Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) recycling programs.

organics.guidance: Composting and yard waste recycling encouraged under FDEP rules; not required statewide.
organics.bin: Green/yard waste bin or compost drop-off.
organics.notes: Many counties offer yard debris and compost collection.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle clean aluminum and steel/tin cans.
metal_containers.notes: Exclude aerosol cans and scrap metal.

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1â€“#2; check local rules for others.
plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Florida does not have a container deposit law.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries at HHW sites.
household_batteries.notes: Keep batteries out of household trash.

e_waste.guidance: E-waste accepted at local HHW and collection centers.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: Film recycling supported statewide by retailers.

bulky_items.guidance: Arrange bulky item pickup or take to landfill.
bulky_items.notes: Local waste management sets schedules and fees.
